subhead: Former French president François Hollande, who was in office at the time of the terror attacks of November 13, 2015, responded to Le Monde readers' questions about the events that left 132 dead and more than 350 injured.

Jeff Bezos' Blue Origin launches NASA Mars mission and sticks booster landing
subhead: Until Thursday, only Elon Musk's SpaceX had accomplished such a maneuver with an orbital-class rocket. The successful launch comes amid intensified rivalry between the two billionaire-owned private space companies as NASA recently opened up bids for its planned Moon mission.

title: Iran faces its worst drought in six decades, considers 'evacuating Tehran'
subhead: The country is experiencing its sixth consecutive year of drought, with reservoirs supplying several major cities, including the capital, at record lows. This unprecedented situation is linked to climate change but is also the result of poor water management.

title: France qualify for World Cup after defeating Ukraine 4-0
subhead: A moment of silence was observed ahead of kick-off by the 41,000 spectators as France marked the 10th anniversary of the attacks in and around Paris on Friday, November 13, 2015.

title: 'Delhi is no longer livable': Deadly pollution in Indian capital claims more than 17,000 lives each year
subhead: Millions of firecrackers set off during the Hindu festival of Diwali at the end of October have worsened the already extreme fine particle pollution engulfing the megacity. Every winter, Delhi's 30 million residents face a toxic nightmare, while blistering heat waves strike the city each summer.

subhead: Le Monde has gathered exclusive first-hand testimonies and created a 3D Bataclan reconstruction to revisit the night that changed France, 10 years ago.

title: Rosalía returns with mystical album: 'God has given me so much, the least I could do is make an album for him'
subhead: Three albums and a string of hit singles have propelled her to the ranks of global pop divas. After a three-year hiatus, the 33-year-old Catalan artist returns with 'Lux,' a musical fresco in praise of the divine and major female saints.

title: She was hanging from the Bataclan's window. He caught her hand.
subhead: Sébastien and Charlotte should never have met. Yet their lives have been inextricably linked since a tragic night in November 2015, when the young man saved the pregnant woman clinging to a window ledge as they both tried to escape the terrorists.
